website_summaries.verdict: Not practical for all dogs, but its shape and build is great for those that are large and tough on chew toys.
pros: Sports a unique round design that is easy to grip, and Nylabone's original chicken flavor that attracts dogs
Holds up to powerful chewers – some consumers report that it lasts up to 6 months
cons: It's a bit heavy and large – a negative for small dogs but a plus for big dogs that spend a lot of time chewing

customer_reviews.title: TOO HARD dog broke tooth
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: should have went with my gut when I was worried it was too hard. Broke my dog’s back molar right in half. Tooth extraction cost almost $1,000. Most expensive toy ever. Pic attached. Original review: Very hard. Could break teeth. Dog likes it. She’s goes thru toys SO FAST because she’s a manic, so it’s nice this one lasts a bit longer.
customer_reviews.author: D.Nuttz

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous and unpleasant
customer_reviews.text: Horrible if your dog is an aggressive chewer. In a very short time it was so full of sharp projections where he had chewed that it felt uncomfortable holding it in my hand and wondered if he was going to injure the soft tissues in his mouth. The vet said these nylabones can cause dogs to crack their teeth. I threw it away as soon as he wasn't looking.
customer_reviews.author: Culturally curious

customer_reviews.title: Super durable for heavy chewers!!
customer_reviews.text: The nylabone durachew line of hard chew toys are the only toys I trust leaving in my dog's kennel with him. Everything else, including an extreme kong, will get destroyed. Plus he loves them! This ring usually lasts about 6 months before it just looks gross and I replace it - however, it is still completely intact, just worn down, after those 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: 🌟 Emma Elizabeth 🌟

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: I buy these types of chew toys for my dog all the time as she loves to chew. This one however is awful! I gave to my Dog and walked away for 10 mins to find her nose bleeding everywhere. When she chewed it, it left it rough and because it’s round it ripped apart her nose while she was trying to keep chewing. It went right in the trash!
customer_reviews.author: Clf

customer_reviews.title: Both my dogs did not care for it.
customer_reviews.text: I keep trying to find the perfect chew for my dogs. They hate antlers, they love stuff that lasts them for two minutes like hooves, stuffed animals, trachea, bully sticks and yak cheese sticks. They don't comprehend kongs, even when stuffed with peanut butter. So I have this a go. No dice. I tried throwing it, playing tug with them. I might as well have been enticing them with a slab of concrete. Back to the drawing board with picky power chewers.
customer_reviews.author: l. h.

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: Within 10 minutes, my dog was already ripping off sharp pieces. Maybe this toy holds up to normal chewers but it is way too weak for my 40 lb cattle dog
customer_reviews.author: Matt Feldman

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT a chew toy. Garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money! I buy off Amazon at least weekly, and I think this is probably the only 1-star review I've ever left, but this is absolute garbage. It's made of some kind of rock-hard brown resin and is so heavy my 35-lb. puggle couldn't even carry it. There's no way this could possibly be chewed - I coildn't even sink a fingernail into it. I buy Nylabone products all the time, and this is nothing like any other toy I've ever bought. If it weren't such a hassle to send back, I would. Instead, I'll eat the $6 and toss it. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Tegan M

customer_reviews.title: Good chew for a large dog
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 2 year old lab to replace an older dura chew (which was just a smooth ring). She is not the biggest fan of dura chews and gets bored with them quickly. She will occasionally still chew on this one but the flavor and shape are not her favorite. This one is maybe too thick for her to really chew on - she will just chew the corners of it. Probably would be better for bigger dogs (she is a small lab) whose jaws are big enough to get around the ring. It was a good price, and we did not have any issues with her ingesting pieces of the chew.
customer_reviews.author: Maly123Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Buy if you want to break some teeth!
customer_reviews.text: My dog won’t give it the time of day. Chunkiest piece of plastic that seems more like a weapon than a dog chew. Very questionable on how this thing gets any good reviews. 🤯
customer_reviews.author: Lucky Louise

customer_reviews.title: 1/3 toys arrived deformed.
customer_reviews.text: So my dog really likes the peanut butter one and the other one with the three sides. My issue lies with the third one, the 'shrink wrap' or whatever that they apply to this product wasn't properly sealed before they sent it. There are holes on the sealant, my dog obviously immediately found them so I had to take it away as I don't want him to eat strips of plastic. I attached a picture, but this was after I took it away from him because he immediately found the holes. Quality control, please!
customer_reviews.author: Zak

customer_reviews.title: Favorite of my pack.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my labradors' favorite chew toys. The textured bumps on the ring gives them something extra to gnaw, and they can carry it around by holding it in their mouthes. My labs are 60 and 70 pounds, and even with this being a favorite, it's lasted 8 months. It's non-edible, so if you buy this product for your dog, be sure to check it regularly to make sure they aren't getting bits off.
customer_reviews.author: E&E0715Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Worth
customer_reviews.text: Durable! My pitbull is really hard on his toys & destroys them fairly quickly. It's rare for me to feel like I got my money's worth when it comes to chew toys but this one has exceeded my expectations. It's not only very durable but my dog loves it, which is a must. Update: Took Tank 5 months to get the toy to a point it needed replaced. Almost as important, Tank still loves the toy and carries it around the house after 5 months. I am so happy with my initial purchase I just ordered another one to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Rob S.

customer_reviews.title: Misleading..not all made in USA
customer_reviews.text: Gave this product 3 stars because only 2 of the 3 items us made in the USA, the 3rd one, the wishbone shaped one, is made in China. Who in their right mind would unknowingly give their pets anything made in China? So many issues with their products and toxic crap in them. Tossed the 1 item in the trash since I can't really return just 1 of the 3, and called it even.
customer_reviews.author: JustMe

customer_reviews.title: Amazon is killing the planet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Australian Cattle Dog power chewer....he HATES IT...WONT TOUCH IT..NONE OF THE OTHER 3 DOGS WILL TOUCH IT. Its like a unwanted piece of petrified poo on our carpet. Dont waste your money. A piece of dog unfriendly trash in a world of enough planet killing trash! Why did amazon have to bring it to my house wrapped in a huge box with plastic airbags like it was fragile?? AMAZONS CARBON FOOTPRINT IS KILLIKING THE PLANET.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great chewing Ring BUT Broke on 3rd day!
customer_reviews.text: Our dog is a powerful chewer so we buy a lot of Nylabone products. Her previous Chew Ring was almost 3 years old and showed signs of wear so we ordered a new DuraChew Ring and threw the older one out. I would have rated her old one 5 stars. She immediately made the new one her favorite toy but on the third day, it broke when she dropped it! We are replacing it with a thicker, more dense shape. Because it broke so quickly, I can only rate it 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: CMS

customer_reviews.title: Too Heavy (weight) for a Smaller Dog!
customer_reviews.text: These are Heavy toys, which I ordered for my "little" 14 lb Chiwinnie. She's a rescued Stray. Absolutely adorable, but learning abt having "tous" for the 1st time. Unstuffed fabric toys are being eaten by her, so was looking for toys she Can't chew up. I Wish someone else had said these were heavy! I probably wasted my money on these. Am sure they'd be Great for a big dog, but my 14 lb girl probably Won't touch them. Unfortunately, I'd opened all but one, b4 realizing how truly heavy they are, so.I can't return them.
customer_reviews.author: sassytexasgirl

customer_reviews.title: Hard bone, dog wanted to chew it up.
customer_reviews.text: On the fence with this. Good product and all, I’ve order many NylaBone items and they all are good but my pooch has developed a sneezing problem after she received this chew toy. Maybe she broke a tooth on it, or it’s just something else, we are headed to the vet today. It is a very hard toy just like the aggressive chewer bones but maybe a tad harder. Otherwise she loved it right off the bat. Update: threw the toy out, symptoms cleared up in 2 days. Nothing wrong with my pooch.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Maybe Harmful
customer_reviews.text: I don't like items for dogs that warn you the dog can't eat it. That being said, I bought this anyway because it looked like it could survive my Pits. It has survived, but not for the right reason. Once they chew around the outside, the whole thing becomes sharp and jagged. It's tough and sharp for them to pick up and the dogs are probably finding out it hurts their mouth due to the shape. It does not fit in their mouths. If it was not a circle, it most likely would be fine. But I think it's painful for them to chew.
customer_reviews.author: Pax Man

customer_reviews.title: My teething puppy loves this and so do some of ...
customer_reviews.text: My teething puppy loves this and so do some of his bigger friends that he shares this with when they visit. This is definitely intended for bigger dogs, it's heavy and is clearly made for some hardcore chewing, but my 4 month old shepherd mix loves it. One of our golden friends that has chewed completely through several plastic bones in seconds chewed on this for an hour and its still going very strong.
customer_reviews.author: Gary S

customer_reviews.title: For the Extreme Chewer
customer_reviews.text: One of our dogs could care less. She just wants to be laying in bed with Dad. The other dog is part Rhodesian Ridgeback and an EXTREME chewer. She chews logs, trees (still vertical), shoes, window sills, everything and destroys it. This is the only toy that lasts and keeps her from chewing stuff that I want unmoleste. We have three. Two wander around the yard and one is on the bedroom floor. Watch out the half remaining pieces are like lego if you step on them in the middle of the night. Great for our dog but less aggressive chewers might not like it as much.
customer_reviews.author: Mother of bookworms

customer_reviews.title: 12 lb chihuahua mix loves this
customer_reviews.text: We adopted a 2 year old chihuahua mix a couple of months ago and it turns out that the only toys she enjoys are those she can chew. Nylabone power chew toys are her favorite and this ring is her favorite out of them all. Shape makes it easier for her to hold is stable and she seems to love the flavor. She's got a small mouth, but this isn't too large for her; it just takes her longer to make a serious dent in it than it would a larger dog. This toy definitely lasts longer than a standard "small" size nylabone. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: LyinLyon

customer_reviews.title: My Corgi hates this thing. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: It’s like these toy creators think “as long as a dog can’t chew threw it , it will make a great toy!” Wrong! Have they ever met a dog? Have they even met my dog? He, like many dogs, loves to chew things because of their texture and he does not find rigid hard plastic with no taste and no give whatsoever pleasant to chew. He gives this zero attention unless I put some peanut butter on it and then he licks it off and still doesn’t chew it. It’s hard as a rock with no give and nothing exciting about it. Maybe someone’s big dog will like it. My dog is a Corgi.
customer_reviews.author: Kagome

customer_reviews.title: love love love
customer_reviews.text: my dog is a chewer.... like we cant get him toys because he makes a project out of figuring out ways to destroy them. we found that rams horns work great but gets slimy and starts to stink ugh and then i saw this was a bit skeptical since my dog is a master mind of destruction however .....This cycle thing is GOLD..... it tastes like bacon to him i guess he hasn't been able to chew through it. he just gnaws on it mindlessly and there is NOOOOO SMELL
customer_reviews.author: Micheal c

customer_reviews.title: Finally a chew toy that can stand up to my aggressive chewer
customer_reviews.text: My aggrestive chewer has been working out on this chewy pretty hard and it seems to be holding up quite well. Yes it is a nylabone so it tends to get little sharp spots but it is still together in one piece and that says a lot. Up to now nothing has stood up to the intensive of my lab puppy's heavy workout with those teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Southern by Heritage

customer_reviews.title: Great for insane power chewers
customer_reviews.text: My dog is newly adopted and 9 month old lab mix. He tore threw "durable" toys such as some Kong toys and Tuffy toys within minutes because he uses he back teeth to saw them. It is utterly insane watching him go through different toys. Currently, he adores this and the Nylabone Power Chew Dino. If you have a dog that tears through toys then this is a good option. We have also had a lot of luck with the extreme Kong toys that are black rubber. I can see this lasting well over a month. It is large and a bit heavy, so keep that in mind if you have smaller dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Brock

customer_reviews.title: German Shepard pup loves this toy!
customer_reviews.text: My 13 mo. old german shepard puppy is having a blast with this ring. Seems pretty much indestructible and she's got those amazingly sharp puppy teeth combined with a massively forceful bite capacity. Thus far seems like a great purchase. We haven't had problems with broken pieces of toy or as some others mention, teeth. Guess depends on each particular dog. Have had other Nylabone toys that were also great but she managed to destroy those in a few months so am figuring with the size of this ring, it'll last longer. I would recommend depending on your dogs age and health. Large breed chewing puppies . . . . .awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Linnae

customer_reviews.title: Not a popular toy
customer_reviews.text: We have 4 dogs; 2 we rescued that were living on the street, and 2 purebreds. NONE OF THEM liked this chew toy, not one; they wouldn't 'touch' it. Not a one of them chewed it. Yeah sure, they all sniffed at it at one time or another, but none of them actually chewed on it. The cat however LOVES it. Not as a chew toy, but as something to bat around and chase (we've got tile floors). HE has endless fun with it, but the dogs rejected it. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Olson

customer_reviews.title: Brought zero interest to my aggressive chewer
customer_reviews.text: It might as well be a diamond. My Doberman destroys every toy, given they have some weakness. This thing is like a rock and sure does discourage chewing...by making it no fun and thus never used. Save your money and give your dog a rock instead. They will ignore it all the same. NOT for big huge adult bully breeds, they need a challenge not cubic zirconium.
customer_reviews.author: deathnesia

customer_reviews.title: Breaks into pieces
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I have a normal bone shaped bone, that my Pit/Shepherd mutt has chewed since the day we got him... or shortly after. We also have Kong Red Circle Cone Treat still left... But this Ring he took out to the back patio, dropped it, and it is in a bunch of in mouth size pieces... meaning when he brings one in where I can find it, it is soon in the trash. It was very much a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Kiristie Flores

customer_reviews.title: My dogs favorite chew toy.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love love love Nyla bones i pretty much have every style bone in the power chewer category. I have been fostering dogs for over 13 years now and I always get every foster their very own nyla bone to chew on and to take with them. They will still argue over who has what. It does not matter that i have three of this toy and there are three of them. Nope they all want the one the other has...kids. You can't go wrong with the power chew line though. They hold up really well. I even toss mine in the top rack of the dishwasher when they get gross.
customer_reviews.author: Gina CentralTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Aggressive chewers will love this toy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toy for aggressive chewers. I have 2 for my Golden Retriever -- one for home and one for away. He cannot destroy it, and his teeth marks in it just seem to make it more interesting. Update: I have just purchased 2 more of these toys. One for the office and one for my 2nd car. This has been the best investment toy that I have bought my aggressive chewer over hundreds of other toys that he has destroyed -- some within 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: keeptherepublic

customer_reviews.title: Almost a good buy... I wont get them again
customer_reviews.text: Sorry I dont like writing bad reviews but I purchases these toys because I have a tough dog that chews up all toys. Well this one is no exception. 1st day he chewed on of the toys and it started to chip. This can be dangerous for the dog, since the package says if digested to pls take the dog to the doctor. He originally like the toy but have to dump it now I wont take that risk with my dog eating something that will harm him.
customer_reviews.author: Tristina Allen

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for our 12 mo old chewer!
customer_reviews.text: Our 12 month old German Shepherd has been destroying dish towels (inside) and tree branches (outside), so we’ve been on the search for a good chew toy for her for a while. This is the first one that has lasted more than 1 day without being destroyed. It’s been two weeks and she chews on it daily. I’m happy not to be finding little chunks of it laying around for me to pick up and she’s not digesting anything she shouldn’t be. We saved the other two for when she gets bored of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel K Clausen

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my brown labrador & she LOVES it!!! It's very durable & she will walk around the house with it hanging out of her mouth. This item is very good for dogs that like to chew! The only downside to this product is it will hurt if you step on it or the dog drops it on your foot because they want to play. As she chewed it sharp pieces poked up/out, it is a thick plastic & is hefty. It has lasted a long time though! Even with the slight downside to it I would definitely buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Peaches

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy...not for smaller breeds
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Min Pin but it is way too heavy. I was mistaken to believe that if I bought the larger size for a bigger dog but it would work fine for my little pup, but that is not the case. The quality seems to be very sturdy and construction appears good probably for a big tough dog. I’m going to donate mine to the shelter but I’ve learned my lesson on buying larger size dog toys for my 15 pound fur baby
customer_reviews.author: Callie

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than an hour
customer_reviews.text: We have a strong 1 1/2-year-old lab/hound mix that has a propensity to swallow things he shouldn't. he is very mouth and oral fixated and is a fixated chewer. Already had to have one obstruction removed at just under $6,000 vet bill. We hoped from the write-up and reviews this would service that niche for him. Sadly, no, he had it broken into a swallow size obstruction in less than an hour with it. Two of them in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: SStrout

customer_reviews.title: Very good for teething dogs
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my French bulldogs favorite toys. We have had no problems with pieces breaking off and he has had it for some time. It seems to be very soothing on his teeth due to the texture throughout the ring. He is a happy guy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nts

customer_reviews.title: Dogs have zero interest in these nylabone products
customer_reviews.text: My old lab and now my two new rescue dogs (retrievers) refuse to have anything to do with any kinda nylabones, any shape, any size. Not sure what breeds actually use these things. They prefer to chew on books, plastic hangers, cardboard, rip papers/magazines to shreds...they in short, want to destroy. Therefore, nylabones are like rocks. There isn't even a smell factor to interest them. It was worth a try! Now to donate all my nylabones to a shelter!
customer_reviews.author: MilkyWay

customer_reviews.title: Pit bull paradise
customer_reviews.text: Most pittie owners know that stuffed animal toys are torn to shreds within five minutes. It’s hard to find toys that are not regular bones, and everything else says nothing digestible’. Those things are usually also easy to chew on. These take a long time for the dogs to chew into, and it’s small little pieces that flake off. They’re not able to bite off chunks of this and swallow them. They’re gonna last forever
customer_reviews.author: Katarina G.

customer_reviews.title: Lab loves chewing this before bed
customer_reviews.text: My gf's yellow lab is the most aggressive chewer I've ever seen - easily tearing through all kinds of products labeled "Military Grade" "For aggressive chewers" "Indestructible", etc. She's incredibly smart, and even knows to go for the seams on stuffed animals and tennis balls and rip out toy squeakers. She has certain toys though that she loves chewing to calm down before falling asleep, but often have to be replaced because she goes through them at a decent pace. This Nylabone power chew ring is built tough - not harmful or toxic, has lasted longer than any toy yet, and the ridges seem very satisfying to her. Glad I bought for sure.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: I got this a while back for my avid chewer puppy. However, I realized too late I needed softer stuff so I put this in a drawer for when he was a little older, and not teething. Well I opened it up today and the plastic is peeling off of it, it's chipped, basically it's useless. and since I waited so long to open it I know I won't get my money back so it was a waste of money. Completely disappointed as Nylabone is usually better made than this.
customer_reviews.author: QueenEvil

customer_reviews.title: Great assortment of chew toys
customer_reviews.text: Nylabone package is great for my dogs. They love the peanut butter toy & have chewed on it the most. Next is the Wishbone bison flavor toy. One of my pitbulls went for that one right away. The circle one, the young dog likes to carry around in his mouth to offer to humans. But it's the least chewed toy. All in all a good pack of chew toys for dogs who have strong chewing. It's a well made chew toy. They have left gouges but none of them have broken in half.
customer_reviews.author: 1mercury

customer_reviews.title: Durable but depends on your dog
customer_reviews.text: This is very durable but for my power chewer, he keeps gnawing away at it until his mouth is bleeding. We have to let him have it for a little while and then take it away so that he doesn’t hurt his mouth. Apparently he doesn’t care and will continue to gnaw away but we care! This is our 2nd one as he will keep pulling chewed parts and eventually start getting pieces off so we threw the first one away. This is still one of the longest lasting toys for our dog (a few months), barely anything seems to last over here with this boy (27lb basenji)
customer_reviews.author: 3macs

customer_reviews.title: It's so easy for carry around and hold due to the round ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this Nylabone. She always carries it around, and gets frustrated when she loses it and can't find it. The last one we had lasted a few months. It's so easy for carry around and hold due to the round shape. The only downfall is the burrs that fall off as she chews, which get caught on our socks, but we live with it because this toy can keep her entertained for a long time (which is hard). We will continue to buy as long as it is available.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love it, I keep doing doubletakes
customer_reviews.text: The dogs love it, it's getting carried around everywhere and chewed on, they loved it immediately. Me? Not so much. I SWEAR it looks like a big old poop circle. Like one of my awful four legged furry housemates just decided to take a great big Cleveland Steamer on the floor and gift me with it. I have looked twice at this brown ring on the floor SO MANY TIMES since it arrived. My kids agree, "mommy I keep thinking it's poop". Yep, yes, honey, I know. It does. So if you aren't worried about your dog toy resembling a giant turd - this will be fine for you. I'm just gonna try to ignore it.
customer_reviews.author: Foxtato

customer_reviews.title: Buy them separately
customer_reviews.text: My dogs both love the wishbone looking toy but the neither really cares for the other two. The ring is a total waste. It is super heavy and awkward. My 80 lb Doberman picked it up once dropped it immediately and hasn’t touched it since. My teething puppy tried it a couple of times but it so thick it’s just hard to chew. I recommend just buying the wishbone looking one. The design is great. My dogs prop it up and chew it constantly.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Firm material, doesn't seem to flake
customer_reviews.text: My two labs seem to enjoy this style of toy from Nylabone. Some of their products flake off, and this one does not seem to do that. Because of that, I have purchased a second one for their enjoyment and my peace of mind. The various nubs seem to be of interest for my dogs. It isn't their favorite chew, but among all the toys they have this one makes a regular appearance. Sometimes they chew on it, often they just play with it, or carry it around. I give it five stars because it has help up extremely well, and it continues to pique their interest over the year or so we have had these.
customer_reviews.author: Precise DisarrayTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Dog not interested for more than a few minutes--too hard.
customer_reviews.text: My lab-shepard mix mouths sticks and stones, so I thought the harder toys would be best for distraction. She's not really interested, and even after soaking it, i'm not sure that there's any real "chicken" there. If there was any flavor, she would be licking it. Finally, it's super-hard and I really think it's a bad idea to tell people that broken teeth are acceptable. I'm returning another Nylabone toy that has similar problems. This one goes in the "bin".
customer_reviews.author: Quality Manager Guy

customer_reviews.title: Very durable and good for powerful chewers says owner of 1 year old 90 pound Blue Nose Pitbull
customer_reviews.text: I usually never buy anything but Kong toys for my dog because they're extremely long lasting for powerful chewers like puppy pitbulls. I saw this toy had a lot of good reviews so I figured I could give it a try especially for the price, let me tell you it is well worth it! usually bones I get my dog are broken into pieces within a day but shes still working at it. I did just get it today so I'm going to post up another review letting people know how long it lasts for a power chewer. I hope this review helps!
customer_reviews.author: Alexys Bonaventure

customer_reviews.title: Dog Was Not At All Interested
customer_reviews.text: I took this out of the package, which BTW looks nice, and walked around the room with anything I would normally give him to get him excited, before dropping it on the floor and walking away. He literally looked at it for a moment, kind of licked it and nibbled on it, and that was that. It's going to make a great paper weight. From my standpoint (a human), the toy seems like it's way too hard. And isn't it supposed to smell like something? I smelled it; got nothing. I suppose at least it's only $4.99. I gave 2 stars because the packaging was of a good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Nick S

customer_reviews.title: Great for tough chewers!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs chew these instead of things they should not chew. They love these things and are occupied for hours by them! Most chew sticks are gone within a day, but these take weeks for my dogs to chew through. Be careful and take them away from your dogs when they break open the ring. Also, they become a very sharp object after a lot of chewing, so be careful not to step on them!
customer_reviews.author: Nerdy Girl

customer_reviews.title: My dog has no interest in it whatsoever
customer_reviews.text: It was supposed to be somewhat attractive to the dog. Perhaps a little scent? Flavor? Doesn't smell like anything. Just a piece of durable material.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Subpar Dog Chew
customer_reviews.text: I bought this dog chew for my 6 month old puppy. My hopes were to keep her busy in her kennel after being spayed. We own the yellow nylabone similar to this one (as well as other nylabone products) but none of them have the defects this one has. As you can see in the pictures, this chew is not safe to give a dog. It has cracks and plastic bubbles. This chew toy looked like this straight out of the package. I will not be giving it to my dog. If I could rate this product a zero I would.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Adams

customer_reviews.title: Why was this highly rated? Why?
customer_reviews.text: My dog will gnaw on anything, except this. Scouty, our Golden Retriever, was so excited when this arrived. Upon opening, he sniffed it, took it, dropped it. He tried again later that day. It’s been chewed a total of 5 minutes. Dog friends were here over the holiday. They played (aka shredded) all of Scouty’s toys, except for this highly-rated chew toy. Hard, heavy, stinky, bad mouth feel. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: My pitty LOVES them.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace an old nylabone my pit has tried for nearly 3 years to chew through. She was upset when I took her bone, but I gave her these and she was in heaven. Her favorite is the Bison Flavored wishbone, but she has gnawed on all three. Regular toys get chewed to pieces in a heartbeat, but these nylabones will withstand my sweet baby's heavy chewing. Highly recommend if your furbaby is a strong chewer.
customer_reviews.author: Lannie

customer_reviews.title: Made of plastic!!😫
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2 puppies who are chewers. I knew something was wrong when I opened the packaging, as it had a chemical smell to them. I washed them with soap and water and gave it to them. Well needless to say they were not impressed at all. They dropped them on the floor and they broke in half ! These feel like they are nothing but hard plastic ! What a waste !
customer_reviews.author: R. MCCARTER

customer_reviews.title: My dog doesn't like any of them
customer_reviews.text: My 6 month old Airedale has no interest in these bones and hasn't really since the day they arrived a couple months ago. The consistency is more plastic and I think maybe that's why she's not into it. I WISH she likedthem because she's getting to that point that she needs something to keep her busy. They don't have any odor or smell so maybe just not appealing to her.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: GREAT toy/teeth cleaner!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my dog's favorite toys; he's had several. He's an australian shepherd/collie mix and loves to chew and is a powerful chewer. Yet this toy lasts and lasts....probably each one about 8-9 months before he's able to bite off pieces big enough to be worrisome. Until that happens, this is always one of his favorite toys to pick out of his toy box. Maybe THE best part, however, is that he's not going to need any expensive dental cleaning from the vet because of this toy! It's invaluable at reducing/removing plaque and tartar and that alone is well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Annie07Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Surviving so Far
customer_reviews.text: I have a large dog, with a tendency to destroy or lose chew toys. I gave him this round nylabone chew early in December (2019), and so far it has lasted a little over a month. He hasn't lost interest in it yet, and it hasn't started falling apart yet. Bonus points for it being thicker than they bones he's had, so that it has yet to disappear under the furniture and have him desperately trying to dig it out.
customer_reviews.author: nonersays

customer_reviews.title: Great for heavy chewers!
customer_reviews.text: We've had a really hard time finding toys for our 8 month old 1/2 Husky rescue puppy ( over 55 lbs already) She's a very heavy chewer and destroys every toy we give her, including several Kong toys which are usually pretty durable. We can't give her rawhide chews or Bully Sticks. She eats them too quickly and gets hunks off that are way too large. We found these Nyabone toys and are thrilled! She loves them and hasn't been able to destroy them. We have 4 different ones and she chews them all happily. I highly recommend them if you have a strong chewer in your family.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon fan

customer_reviews.title: My Dogs Love These
customer_reviews.text: My dogs (2 Siberian Huskies) are big chewers, and Nylabones are some of their favorites. These is no different, and as expected they've held up against their powerful jaws and teeth. They're still going strong a few months after purchase, and I expect they will last several more years before one gets worn down enough to throw out. Highly recommended for powerful chewers!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy H.

customer_reviews.title: Hard Plastic with No Flavor
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THESE if you love your dog. Deceptively pictured, these are not soft or semi-soft. They are made of a very hard indestructible plastic that will probably break your dog's teeth as I have just learnt in a couple reviews. THEY HAVE NO FLAVOR. I actually took them away from my dogs. They may serve a better job of wedging something or decorating my pond.
customer_reviews.author: Xarkmaster

customer_reviews.title: GREAT for german shepherds!
customer_reviews.text: I used this toy on my 25 lbs Dachshund dog and on my >100+ lb German Shepherd. Honestly size wise it was a better fit for the geman shepherd BUT my lil Dachshund loved it. He's an aggressive chewer and enjoyed biting on it. Although it is a bit too big for him it didn't stop him from running around with tit. Both have been aggressively chewing on it for a week and its barely left a dent on the product. I expect it to last months!
customer_reviews.author: Simplylovelyhome

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves it. Durable.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: downgrading from 5 stars to 3 stars. My dog started chewing a little too many bits of plastic off and swallowing them. The toy was mangled within a week. Big enough for a decent sized dog (my dog is 40lbs, but would also work for much larger dogs). He's a crazy chewer, and having toys like this keeps him from chewing up furniture (still waiting for him to completely abandon the habit before I get a new couch ^-^). I'm sure he's eaten a few bits of plastic off of it, but the bits he chews off are too small to cause any internal blockage.
customer_reviews.author: HL

customer_reviews.title: Xtra strong toys
customer_reviews.text: I have a German Shepard/Rottweiler Mix who's a little over two years old who chews through (literally) every product I have bought him since birth. These toys are actually holding up really well and its been a few months. Very impressed!
customer_reviews.author: J. Neal

customer_reviews.title: The one we were shipped was poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The ring shipped to us had what looked like clear plastic on it that started flaking off as soon as our dog started chewing on it. I contacted Nylabone and they had me ship it to their QA department. They advised it was some of the plastic that didn't mold properly, had our dog ingested it, it wouldn't have hurt him, and they sent me back products that more than covered the cost of the ring and shipping it to them
customer_reviews.author: Joe Schmoe

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves this
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this chew ring. She got it for Christmas and it has held up pretty well. I bought her a second one recently because the first one was getting a little sharp-ish from her excessive chewing. It wasn't bothering me or her too much, but I have little kids and didn't want them picking it up. My dog wasn't a big chewer to begin with, but she uses this thing for maybe an hour everyday. Can't complain!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa R

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, but...
customer_reviews.text: This review is by my dog Barney, not me. I thought the chew toy was a good idea. On the subject of longevity, this one will last forever because my aggressive chewer, my 18-month-old 65lb Aussie, won't touch it. I even tried smearing peanut butter on it. He licked it off, but disdains the toy. I tried to interest him in fetching it if I threw it--he says, "Nope. Gimme my frisbee or ball." I'll try using it as a doorstop--got to be some use for it. Maybe your dog will love it.
customer_reviews.author: KMcKay

customer_reviews.title: I can’t believe I bought it again!!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe I bought this chew toy again. Many years ago, I bought one for my golden retriever pup (she passed @ 11 years old.) Try as I might, she wouldn’t chew it. I still had it years later & tried it on my rescue terrier mix, he wouldn’t chew it. Somehow I forgot all that & bought another of these rings for my new corgi pup. She won’t chew it. Something about the shape, I don’t know, but 3 puppies over many years have snubbed this toy.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara J. Christensen

customer_reviews.title: 70 lbs lab/boxer's favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: My 70 lb boxer-lab mix destroys just about anything you give him, and the powerful chewers variety of nylabones are the only things that withstand him! He loves this toy, he seems to enjoy the texture of it. It's heavy and durable and he plays with it often and it's holding up fantastic, just like his other nylabones. The only downside to these is that they become pointy and sharp after being chewed on, but that's easy to look past for the job it does occupying my pup. I'll continue to purchase these toys.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Can Withstand Strong Chewer
customer_reviews.text: I have a pitbull/chihuahua mix who is a very strong chewer. Typically she can destroy almost all toys made for tough chewers and I try to stick with nylabone products because those are the only ones she doesn’t destroy. This did not disappoint and after months I can see hardly any damage. She loves it. I would purchase again and again. The only con if I had to pick one is that it is a little heavy, like too heavy to throw inside.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Supper Durable!
customer_reviews.text: This chew toy is supper durable. Having had it since Christmas morning there is barely any ware and tear to it. Our dog plays/chews on this everyday and carries it around the house. It has held together very well and has been keeping him from chewing other things. He is a very aggressive and strong chewer: other toys have lasted merely hours before being completely torn apart. I am glad that we got him this and recommend it to anyone else that has a strong, aggressive, chewing dog.
customer_reviews.author: HeinzBarron

customer_reviews.title: A must have for aggressive chewers!
customer_reviews.text: Have a pack of four dogs (shepherd, American Staffordshire, black lab, and a chi-whinnie) and all of them love it. We buy them a couple at a time to have throughout the house. A must have for aggressive chewers! One "con"- Sort of. Make sure to put them back in the toy bin after chew time is over. Barefoot + chewed nylabone = many bad words spoken. Dont say you werent warned!🤣
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT THEY DESERVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I cannot express enough how worth it these toys are. My pit lab mix 1 year old loves it. She can't destroy and swallow pieces of it yet it's still intriguing to her. We have gone through countless amount of toys and money. These toys have saved us so much money.
customer_reviews.author: Nereida Ortega

customer_reviews.title: Value in longevity and durability
customer_reviews.text: I have a dog who is an aggressi've chewer. He demolishes everything toy-wise we have bought him. This has lasted longer than most. He likes to chew on this, but it isn't a favorite - not saying he has a favorite. He never gets it without prompting, when he does get it he chews it for a while before being distracted (he is still a puppy, just over a year old). Combine this and I think it is a good value for longevity and holding up to the vigorous chewing.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tough toy, potential risk for dog
customer_reviews.text: This toy was much tougher than I expected. This toy definitely holds up to the biting from my dogs (pitbull). However, this appears to be a bit too tough for them. I am hesitant to give them the toy because based on the size, weight, and solidness, I can see this doing damage to their teeth. If you’ve tried everything else and your dog has been able to chew through it this may be a good option but be weary of potential damage.
customer_reviews.author: HW

customer_reviews.title: Buy this for a power chewer!!!
customer_reviews.text: My dog absolutely loves this chew toy! He 'protects' it if he thinks we might move it. He even sleeps with it. Our dog is a 100 lb, pit mix, power chewer. He will eventually chew this apart, but this has already lasted longer than most toys. He has had it for about a month; you can see some of the wear. My ONLY negative is that there are little bits of the nylabone material that end up on the floor and those bits are pokie! It is to be expected though as the toy gets chewed on a lot. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Momma J

customer_reviews.title: Love these toys!
customer_reviews.text: I have a German shepherd & yellow lab. Both love chewing and have very strong teeth. I hate shopping for toys at the pet store because they are so expensive but then only last 2 days. These are the best toys I have ever bought. They last forever, don't create a mess or break apart & they are good in size. This is honestly a bang for your buck! Highly recommend to anyone with a dog that loves to chew.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Great for strong chewers!
customer_reviews.text: We saw this in a store in person and checked online for pricing and it was half the price here! The toy arrived on time and the product is the EXECT same. We buy these for our german shepherd in order for them to last more than a week. It has been holding strong and not peeling into little plastic pieces like some plastic chew toys may do. We love the nylabone brand and mixed it up with this circle instead of a bone shape.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay B

customer_reviews.title: Ok at first.......
customer_reviews.text: This held up well at first, but my dog is an aggressive chewer. After a week she was biting pieces off, that were an ingestion hazard. The material is not edible. If your dog doesn't chew hard, it may be ok. But I wouldn't buy it again. I buy elk antlers (split) now. All natural, not messy..
customer_reviews.author: Jerome P.

customer_reviews.title: Too hard for anything that a dog would want to use it for.
customer_reviews.text: It is so hard that my extremely chewy 4 month old collie won't even touch it. He has no idea why I'm handing him a rock solid, hard piece of plastic. No good at all for teething puppies, or even any dog, for anything. Can't even toss it. I'm not sure what some of the pictures are showing in the reviews because I purchased a hard, dark brown, round chew toy (sold for teething puppies or dogs who are heavy chewers) that ended up being as hard as any plastic could ever be.
customer_reviews.author: Dayna B.Top Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Not pleased
customer_reviews.text: I wish that product information had been on the description that it was not intended to be digested. I made the mistake by not going on to the second page to "read" the 2nd page, and since it was my mistake, it isn't returnable without a restock fee. I guess I will count it as a loss because I won't give it to my dog or anyone's dog... I will try to pay more attention in the future, but why would you make a chew that could harm the animal ?
customer_reviews.author: SisterJ

customer_reviews.title: Now, this IS a non destructible chew toy.
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion, this is the BEST Nylabone product. I had a Cane Corso Mastiff that would be able to chew through anything. I even bought one of those "Non destructible" toys of which he chewed through in about 30 seconds. This really helped his desire to chew things and he would carry it with him easily with the ring shape. I now bought one for my new puppy and she likes it too. Not as an aggressive of a chewer (yet), but she likes it too. GREAT Product.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Could be dangerous!
customer_reviews.text: I left the Nylabone Power Chew Textured Dog Chew Ring on the floor for my dog to play with and later found it in four pieces! Ture, I have a large German Shepherd, but this shouldn't have happened! Please always make sure to supervise your dog while he chews on this toy - it could turn into a dangerous choking hazard!
customer_reviews.author: Karen B

customer_reviews.title: Touch Product
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product. I have a 70lb lab and she has chewed all of her toys and this product has given her a challenge. It has been a month now and she is still trying to chew it up. I highly recommend this product for any doggie parents that has a VERY aggressive chewer. I will definitely buy this product again and from the same company.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Mason

customer_reviews.title: Causes bleeding gums
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my dog who is a chewer. It states it's good for heavy chewers. Well they are a sturdy hard toy. But for this pup it only made sharp points that made her gums bleed. Her I'm thinking that I can go to work it will keep her busy. Well it did just that but also tore up her gums. I would absolutely NOT RECOMEND THESE TOYS. I would love to get my money back but that pry won't happen either. Very disappointed!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dori

customer_reviews.title: Dog not interested.
customer_reviews.text: Update: my dog started without it the second day. It looks like she's enjoying it. So going more stars. One down side I see is that the surface of the chew toy is very slippery, so it becomes very messy after a short while when chewing. And my dog doesn't like to keep chewing one spot but all around it. So it's a saliva mess. ----- My dog doesn't like it, sniffed it and tried one bite and never touched again. I don't know why this product gets so many good reviews. My dog shows zero interests. Not sure about the flavor, i can't smell anything.
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie H.

customer_reviews.title: Best chew toy yet!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second time purchasing it for my Pitbull. The first one lasted almost 6 months of constant chewing. No other toy has lasted 6 minutes, including ones from dog toy subscriptions for chewers. Honestly it still isn’t destroyed and he still chews on it, it’s just so gross I can’t stand watching him put it in his mouth anymore. I tell you, though, it’s awful to step on with bare feet!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Angeleri

customer_reviews.title: Totally Worth the Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: At a popular pet store, this Nylabone Power Chew is priced at around $17.00! My dog enjoys this teething ring, chewing toy. He gnaws away at this toy. He really enjoys it! So, I was delighted when I saw this item on Amazon for under $10.00. The quality, longevity, and price of this chewing/gnawing toy is outstanding in my opinion. I highly recommend purchasing this Nylabone Power Chew for your furbaby!
customer_reviews.author: Denise Perez

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for boredom and heavy chewera
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this chew. She is a medium breed. On the cusp of being considered "large" by my vet. But she chews like crazy. This is the only toy that ont only has held up for awhile but also she loves it. She throws it. Flips it. Stomps on it. Rubs herself all over it and chews it for hours. Its not about the flavor. It doesn't smell like anything. I would not recommend this for dogs that only chew on smelly stuff. It lasts her about two months before i have to throw out whats left of it and give her another. For the price its well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy C.

customer_reviews.title: TERRIFICALLY durable chew toy
customer_reviews.text: This Nylabone product is just as described! My pit is an aggressive chewer when given the opportunity, and I've struggled with finding a chew toy that lasts longer than a couple of days. This Nylabone is by far the best purchase I've made for my dog. I've had it for a couple of months, and she has only left chew marks on this ring. She chews on it every day and loves it! I'm sold on Nylabone!! Can't wait to try another toy!
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Aggressive chewer not interested 😒
customer_reviews.text: Our greyhound, who is an aggressive chewer, had no interest in the toy. Even after trying a varsity of methods to engage and entice the dog to play, we had no success. Reading other reviews, it is clear that the toy is a hit or miss. Seems to work great for some dogs and not at all for others. Unfortunately, it did not work on our dog.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Great, durable chew toy that the dogs actually like
customer_reviews.text: I foster dogs and so I am always trying out new chew toys for puppies and young dogs. I am very happy with this product because it is hard enough that they don't break off pieces and swallow them, but also soft enough that they enjoy chewing on it and it doesn't hurt their teeth. I would recommend this for young dogs that have most of their adult teeth in but still want to gnaw on something. All the different dogs that have played with this toy seem to really like it!
customer_reviews.author: Kera Parker

customer_reviews.title: good for the pup, not for the master
customer_reviews.text: Ugh I hate them but my dog loves them. She chews and chews and they get SO SHARP. I can't even hold onto them while she chews. great for puppies though
customer_reviews.author: Amie Anne

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This Nylabone is softer than the original chicken ones. I have German Shepherds, I ended up throwing the one I got away much sooner than the others. I have had several of the original and they are still in great shape and dogs go after them regularly. Unfortunately I have not found the original on Amazon lately so I have been buying at the pet stores. I do not recommend for strong chewers.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon9624

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I got one for each of my dogs, but my Golden decided they are both hers. She caries them both around the house into what ever room we are in. She loves to chew on them, they haven't broke up... which is crazy since everything else I've ever got her she ruins. They do hurt when you kick them in bare feet haha but they are great quality and our baby loves them. Her teeth are actually starting to look a little better as well! I highly recommend for your fur babies!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Peacock

customer_reviews.title: Durable, doesn't look comfy to chew
customer_reviews.text: I like Nylabone and have a lot of their stuff. This is their typical high-quality brew. It's on the harder side of the chewing toy spectrum, but that means it lasts a long time. I go through probably 2 of these a year with 2 dogs. My dogs prefer to chew the straighter toys, but this one still sees some love and lasts a good long while with heavy chewers.
customer_reviews.author: Splintalol

customer_reviews.title: Tough Chews for Medium Chewers
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a hard chewer so I thought these would be good. But he chews small pieces off, and I don't like the idea of little plastic chips in his belly. They are not easy to clean once they have been chewed a bit, dog hair will stick like it's velcro. These toys are good for dogs who probably don't chew as hard as mine does.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for heavy chewers. Not great for bare feet.
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves it. He's a Lab mixed with some kind of Terri or (thinking jack russle) so he's got tons of energy. Energy that is nicely focused on this toy when it's time to calm down for the night. He chews on this thing till he falls asleep. I bought one previously from PetCo (where the pets go), and with the exception of a few sharp edges from chewing, it's still in great condition. We just wanted to get him a new one for his birthday. I expect him to have both of these for a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Jon B.

customer_reviews.title: Not for teething puppies
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't recommend for teething. I bought this for my teething 5 month old german shepherd since he's a pretty heavy chewer but it's way too hard. Am afraid it will knock out a tooth. It's still too heavy for him to carry. I gave it to him for a bit and he chewed on it for about 3 min but then lost interest. I think I'll keep it in the plastic for a few more months until his adult teeth are all in. Definitely made for adult dogs
customer_reviews.author: Edith

product_meta.title: Nylabone Power Chew Textured Dog Chew Ring Toy
product_meta.description: Size:X-Large/Souper - 50+ lbs.| Style:Flavor Medley Textured RingIRRESISTIBLE FLAVOR MEDLEY – Flavored dog chew toy combines all of your dog's favorite tastes in one
feature_bullets: TEXTURED RING SHAPE – Unique shape with enticing textures is easy to hold and satisfies dogs' natural urge to chew
MADE OF DURABLE NYLON – Long lasting dog chew toy challenges even the most aggressive chewers and discourages destructive chewing
MADE IN THE USA – Dog chew toy is proudly made in the United States
PROMOTES DOG DENTAL HEALTH – Ridges and nubs help prevent plaque and tartar buildup as dogs chew
FOR EXTRA-LARGE DOGS – Size Souper chew toy created for dogs 50+ pounds

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
